description: '''Lăutărească music''' ({{Langx|ro|muzică lăutărească}}, {{IPA|ro|ˈmuzikə lə.utərˈe̯askə|pron}}) is a musical tradition widespread in the historical regions of [[Romania]] ([[Wallachia]], [[Moldavia|Moldova]], and [[Transylvania]]. Its performers, known as [[lăutari]], are professional musicians, typically of [[Romani people|Romani]] origin, who play at weddings, christenings, funerals, and other social events. Lăutărească music encompasses a wide repertoire, combining traditional folk melodies with elements from urban, [[Ottoman music|Turkish]], and [[Western classical music|Western European]] musical traditions. Musicians play by ear, often using intricate ornamentation and improvisation. The primary instruments in traditional lăutărească music are the violin, [[Nai (pan flute)|nai]], and [[cobza]].
